title.narrative: Building Resilience through Markets and Sustainable Coffee Production in Western Honduras
Resistencia constructiva a través de mercados y producción sostenible del café en Honduras occidental

description.narrative: (Honduras): .In June 2018, USAID established a Global Development Alliance (GDA) through which it implements an alliance activity with the COHONDUCAFE Foundation, the largest coffee exporter in Honduras, and Jacobs Douwe Egberts, JDE, the second-largest coffee buyer in the world... ..Through the implementation of various Feed the Future activities, COHONDUCAFE has demonstrated valuable experience improving market linkages and promoting key technologies to increase yields and incomes of smallholder farmers. JDE provides critical international marketing expertise to identify potential niche and new markets for Honduran coffee. USAID contributes technical expertise and funds in the amount of $2,080,000 while the COHONDUCAFE Foundation and its partners contribute $2,229,549... ..The purpose of this GDA is to mobilize the private sector to assume the role of an agricultural extension service provider that donors have traditionally played. The GDA is assisting 5,400 households with technical assistance and increased access to markets and credit. The Alliance will sustainably increase coffee yields by 25 percent for approximately 3,800 coffee growers in western Honduras... ..In the immediate aftermath of the COVID-19 pandemic, the Coffee Alliance developed digital channels to provide technical assistance to client farmers. Field technicians use video conferencing and send short videos over messaging applications to demonstrate good agricultural practices. With FY 2020 funds, this activity will partner with telecommunications companies to increase its reach with virtual technologies..

(Honduras): .USAID firmó este desarrollo global Alliance (GDA) para establecer la actividad de Alliance del café con la fundación de COHONDUCAFE, Compañ ia Hondureñ un café del del (COHONDUCAFE), y Jacobs Douwe Egberts (JDE). COHONDUCAFE y la fundación de COHONDUCAFE proporcionarán su experiencia en la gestión postharvest y el proceso de permitir a los hogares del cliente añadir valor y aumentar calidad de su café. JDE ofrecerá inteligencia de mercado, el desarrollo de productos y el asesoramiento en comercialización internacional de identificar el lugar potencial y los nuevos mercados para el café producido por los granjeros Honduran del minifundista. USAID contribuirá $2.080.000 mientras que la fundación de COHONDUCAFE y sus socios contribuirán $2.229.549... . El propósito de este Alliance es movilizar a socios del recurso del sector privado para participar en la cadena de valores del café de modo que puedan asumir que los donantes del papel han jugado tradicionalmente. Estos socios del sector privado tienen un interés directo en el aumento productividad y crear los acoplamientos del mercado que alinean con su modelo de negocio principal. La meta de alto nivel de este Alliance es ayudar a 4.800 hogares del cultivador del café con asistencia técnica y el acceso creciente a los mercados y al crédito. Alliance sostenible aumentará ingresos domésticos en el 25 por ciento para aproximadamente 3.800 hogares del cultivador del café dentro de la zona del DO2 de USAID de la influencia... . Esta actividad alinea con la meta 3: Promueva la dirección americana con el compromiso equilibrado del departamento de estado y de USAID "plan estratégico común FY 2018 - 2022" que anime a sociedades con el sector privado que movilicen recursos.

Improve the capacity of businesses to integrate into domestic and international markets through increases in productivity and improvements in corporate governance and the development and application of modern technology and marketing practices. Enhance the capacity of businesses and business associations in terms of their corporate governance capabilities and their application of best practices and technologies to achieve increased production and marketing of products and services. It includes adoption of efficient production processes, improved labor productivity, environmentally-sound management of natural resources and the development of accounting and management systems that can help the company and industry group implement business, labor, product and process standards that enhance business competitiveness. Business capacity development programs may include activities that help men- and women-owned firms and associations respond to these international markets and create regional alliances.

description.narrative: The purpose of the activity is to assist the Government of Jamaica in achieving epidemic control while also ensuring sustainability for the response. To achieve epidemic control, the project will aggressively address key barriers to linkage to care, treatment initiation, retention, and viral suppression. The main objectives are: 1) finding the undiagnosed persons; 2) initiating antiretroviral therapy (ART) on those diagnosed but not on treatment; and 3) achieving viral suppression for those on ART. International best practices and policies based on WHO recommendations will be fast-tracked in order to accelerate progress. Disaggregated epidemiological and program data, combined with key survey results, will serve as the driver for targeted interventions. The response will become more nimble, prioritizing quick, evidence-based course adjustments.

description.narrative: (Zambia): TB LON is USAID/Zambia's premiere local TB award, a key component of the Accelerator to End TB initiative to double the decline in TB incidence and ultimately end TB by 2030. This mechanism will work in Lusaka and Southern Province to close gaps in TB elimination activities in specific populations with high TB burdens, including underserved communities, people in congregate settings such as prisons, mining communities, children, and people living with HIV/AIDS. Using FY 2020 resources the mechanism will focus on: revision and dissemination of updated guidelines; infection control; intensified and active TB case finding, treatment and prevention activities; and capacity building in various areas of TB control. TB LON will build on existing USAID investment through our bilateral Eradicate TB and will leverage PEPFAR as well as other partner and stakeholder funding to implement interventions and ensure provision of essential prevention and treatment services for TB with a view to build sustainability. Under USAID's Country Development Cooperation Strategy, the mechanism will support Development Objective 3: Capacity of Zambia's Government, Citizens and Private Sector Increased to Improve Health Outcomes and Meet Critical Needs of Vulnerable Populations... .

title.narrative: Going the Last Mile for HIV Control

description.narrative: The new program, dubbed Going the Last Mile for HIV Control, was granted with support from the Presidents Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief through USAID and the Zimbabwean Ministry of Health and Child Care (MOHCC). The program will work closely with the MOHCC, as well as other USAID health partners and Development Objective Programs, to create and implement client-centered and evidence-based solutions to fast-track the end of the AIDS epidemic by 2030. The program will change its interventions based on the needs of each population it serves in Zimbabwe at the district-level, creating intervention packages that include pre-exposure prophylaxis, voluntary medical male circumcision and condom market development.The objective of this activity is to accelerate the HIV response for epidemic control and sustain reduction in HIV incidence in Zimbabwe.

title.narrative: Mission Support for Journey to Self-Reliance Pivot(MSP)

description.narrative: (Kenya): The purpose of the Mission Support for Journey to Self-Reliance Pivot (MSP) is to support USAID/Kenya and East Africa (KEA) staff and stakeholders (e.g. local and national governments, local and regional partners) to be more efficient, effective, transparent and skilled in achieving development outcomes through strategic design, performance management, Collaborating Learning and Adapting (CLA), organizational development to enable the Mission advance regional and national journeys to self-reliance (J2SR). MSP equips the Mission to advance the regional and national J2SR by: Providing training on various aspects of the program cycle,supporting the Missions design work,organizing and positioning Missions teams and offices for optimal functionality and providing evidence for decision making..USAID/KEA seeks to advance J2SR for Kenya and the region through its programming and collaboration with local stakeholders. MSP's mandate includes championing the J2SR, providing products and support to advance J2SR among Mission staff and stakeholders, equip staff with knowledge and skills as well as ensuring functional organizational structures.Apart from capacity building and organizational development at the team, office and Mission levels, MSP is also promoting the use of primary metrics, secondary and custom J2SR indicators. MSP oversaw the development of memorandum of understanding with counties to enhance collaboration on common programming areas and to enable counties to take up more of a role in planning, financing and implementing programs to meet their developmental needs. These efforts help local governments to strengthen their effectiveness and sustainability leading to a more stable and prosperous U.S. partner.

title.narrative: Regional Health Integration to Enhance Services in North Acholi (RHITES-NA)

description.narrative: (Uganda): RHITES- N, Acholi supports the implementation of evidence-based integrated maternal, newborn, and child health (MNCH), family planning (FP), HIV/AIDS, tuberculosis (TB), nutrition, and water, hygiene, and sanitation (WASH) interventions in eight districts with a population of 1.5 million people. With $5,203,926 million in FY 2020 funds, the priorities are: implementation of high-impact evidence-based interventions across all the technical areas described above; strengthening community-level interventions to increase demand and uptake of services; strengthening the health system, and improving information management and use of data for decision-making. High-impact interventions targeted for scale-up will include: nutrition in the first 1,000 days; strengthening routine immunizations; access to age appropriate FP information and services; enhancing health worker skills on long-term FP method provision, and improving performance of facility and community-level TB case findings and treatment success rates. .To ensure continuation of services during the COVID-19 pandemic, RHITES-N, Acholi will align interventions with Ugandan Ministry of Health guidance. This will also integrate infection prevention and control activities and support targeted provision of personal protective equipment for service providers and beneficiaries of MNCH, FP, TB, and nutrition services. .RHITES- N, Acholi will support communities to identify and address structural, social, and patient-related barriers to seeking health care. RHITES- N, Acholi will contribute to the Mission's Journey to Self-reliance through engaging stakeholders and beneficiaries using district-based approaches. These approaches will support communities to identify, plan, finance (where possible), and implement solutions to their health challenges, promoting commitment and capacity to provide quality health services. ... .. .

description.narrative: (Uganda): USHA strives to improve water, hygiene, and sanitation (WASH) at the household, institutional, and governmental levels by increasing household access to sanitation and water services; adopting and expanding key hygiene behaviors at home, school, and health facilities; and strengthening district water and sanitation governance for sustainable services. USHA adapts private sector engagement models targeting universal basic sanitation in priority populations..With $3,000,000 in FY 2020 funds, it will implement activities covering 21 districts and three municipalities in Central East, Central West, and Northern Uganda. Activities include: implementing private sector engagement models; financial services for WASH; fecal sludge management business models, and social and behavior change interventions. USHA will build local capacity at the district level, covering aspects of planning, information and data management, advocacy, and coordination. At a national level, the activity supports the Government of Uganda (GoU) to implement the National Sanitation Marketing Guidelines that will facilitate increased private sector participation in sanitation. .It will also support the GoU's COVID-19 response through improved water access and uptake of key behavior practices like hand-washing and infection prevention and control in households, communities, and institutions (health facilities and schools). USHA will build the capacity of three Umbrella Authorities (UAs) which have management responsibility over small piped water schemes. It will provide technical support to improve the UAs' internal performance monitoring systems and development of a pro-poor strategy to guide resource allocation. Additionally, it will support the expansion of these systems to serve new populations, especially health facilities and schools. Improved access to water supplies will dramatically reduce the time required to collect water and enable hand-washing behaviors. ... .

description.narrative: (Uganda): With $2,900,000 in FY 2020 funds, this activity will focus on prioritized accelerator and gateway behaviors that are critical to addressing Uganda's high disease burden. SBCA will use the full range of social and behavior change (SBC) approaches and methodologies to address underlying structural, social, and internal factors that impact health. SBCA will initiate activities in four result areas. These include: developing a deeper understanding of factors that affect the adoption of healthy behaviors, implementing evidence-based SBC interventions for population-level change, strengthening and institutionalizing SBC capacity, and enhancing the information management systems to increase accountability. .To improve adoption of priority behaviors, this activity will work with the Government of Uganda, implementing partners, and stakeholders to design, implement, and scale-up SBC interventions. Such interventions impact health and development outcomes, including: reduction in maternal and child mortality; improved nutritional status; reduction in TB prevalence; reduction of total fertility rates; reduction in new HIV infections, and prevention, detection, and response to other emerging pandemic diseases. .To ensure continuation of services during the COVID-19 pandemic, SBCA will align interventions with the Ugandan Ministry of Health guidance, including risk communication, social mobilization and community engagement. This will also integrate infection prevention and control activities and support targeted provision of personal protective equipment where applicable. .SBCA will contribute to the Mission's Journey to Self-Reliance vision through meaningful engagement of all stakeholders, line ministries, and beneficiaries to identify, plan, and implement local solutions to health challenges...

description.narrative: (Tanzania): A poor enabling policy environment has been identified as one of the most binding constraints to agriculture and economic growth in Tanzania, as reflected in the slow pace of sector growth and under-investment by the private sector in agribusiness. The Sera Bora ("Better Policies") Activity seeks to accelerate the adoption of policies and programs in Tanzania that will drive broad-based agricultural sector growth, improve household food security and nutrition, and reduce poverty. Specifically, FY 2020 funds will be used to facilitate the country's capacity to: (a) conduct research and generate useful data, and interpret and use evidence for informed decision-making; (b) conduct systematic stakeholder engagements in all policy research and outreach activities, and (c) ensure that due process in policy development is followed..Funds will support research, analytical work, and training to improve the capacity of local NGO staff to implement activities and respond to the impacts of COVID-19 on Tanzania's agricultural sector by conducting impact assessment and analytical studies. FY 2020 funds will support SERA BORA's policy and regulatory reforms by training executive and legislative branch staff to interpret and use evidence for better-informed decisions in the agriculture and nutrition sectors. The activity will convene, multi-stakeholder conferences and policy debates on agricultural, nutrition, and rural development, and encourage dialogue and the exchange of data. .These interventions will help achieve the U.S. Government's objectives of improving the business enabling environment and strengthening the capacities of individuals and institutions that are likely to play a major role in the present and future agricultural, food, and nutrition policies. It also furthers Tanzania's journey to self-reliance by developing the ability of the GOT to develop and implement its own sound policies....

title.narrative: BAR AMA BARO (New Somalia Education Activity)

description.narrative: (Somalia): Bar Ama Baro (BaB, "Teach or Learn" in Somali), will increase.access to quality education for out-of-school children and youth aged 8-15 in.targeted regions via increased student enrollment; school safety; literacy,.numeracy, and socio-emotional skills acquisition; greater government capacity.to regulate these schools; and youth involvement in BaB's education efforts..Community teachers, especially female teachers, will be recruited and.trained. Teaching materials will be developed and disseminated, complementing.the government's new formal curriculum. Innovative technology, critical because.of COVID-19's disruption to Somalia's education efforts, will ensure access to.education. BaB will foster positive gender norms and reduce educational.barriers for girls and boys. Community efforts to support education - from.advocacy, mobilization and protection of vulnerable students - will build.resilience to withstand al-Shabaab's ideological attacks and coercive recruitment.techniques. USAID will assist the government and the private sector to.develop accelerated education programming, policies on teacher qualifications.and instructional time, and academic standards. This latter effort will lead to.accreditation of BaB schools, and certification of students so that they may transition.into formal schools at the right level. As a result of the COVID-19 pandemic,.BaB put out risk and community messaging, including simple education messages,.to ensure students remain connected to learning while schools are closed. While.the Ministry of Education intends to open schools in the 2020-2021 school year,.should schools remain closed or be forced to re-close, BaB is planning for a.number of different scenarios to keep students learning during the crisis. .. ... ........ ..

(USAID West Africa Regional): Despite challenges with continuity of family planning (FP) services in the middle of the COVID-19 pandemic, USAID's FP activity continues to adapt, leverage and catalyze pathways to scaling up FP High Impact Practices (HIPs) in Togo, Niger, Burkina Faso, and Côte d'Ivoire. HIPs are critical to enabling countries to achieve their ambitious country-level FP goals and advance the Ouagadougou Partnership (OP) target of 2.2 million additional FP users in the nine OP countries by 2020 and set new goals beyond 2020. .FY 2020 activities include:.Provide high quality FP services in 17 districts with a sustainable and self-regulated facility accreditation system .Support district based integrated learning networks of health facilities that implement and promote replication and scale up of selected FP HIPs and conduct ground-up district-based domestic resources mobilization.Engage FP stakeholders' alliances at district, national and regional levels to mobilize investment on selected HIPs (task shifting including Sayana Press scale up through community health workers, self-injection, postpartum and post abortion care FP, and youth friendly contraceptive services) .Provide nutrition counseling for mothers on infant and young child feeding practices through an integrated package of services..Provide infection prevention measures to ensure providers and facilities safely continue FP provision as essential services in the COVID-19 context .This regional activity seeks to harness the demographic dividend (accelerated economic growth) which is critical to promoting self-reliance via access to voluntary FP services and women's empowerment. .This activity contributes directly to JSP Objective 2.2 (Promote healthy, educated and productive populations in partner countries to drive inclusive and sustainable development, open new markets and support U.S. prosperity and security objectives)..

title.narrative: Alimentez la future activité d'engrais du Sénégal (nouvelle)
Feed the Future Senegal Fertilizer Activity (Dundël Suuf)

description.narrative: (Le Sénégal) : Cette activité sera mise en application par une petite entreprise des USA comme activité de recherche pilote pour commercialiser des occasions d'horticulture pour les agriculteurs ruraux en empaquetant des paquets des services de technologie et de support technique. L'activité évaluera l'hypothèse que si les acteurs d'institutions financières et de séquence de valeurs d'horticulture travaillent ensemble pour offrir les produits et services financiers innovateurs les agriculteurs de petit support peuvent commercialiser leur production horticole. Approximativement deux-tiers du régime sénégalais est concentrés sur des céréales, avec les questions significatives de la malnutrition dans les zones rurales. Les activités se concentreront sur augmenter la qualité et la quantité de production d'horticulture et de sa commercialisation, et améliorer de ce fait la diversité de régime et adresseront l'espace de nutrition.

(Senegal): .The Feed the Future Senegal Fertilizer Activity (Dundël Suuf) aims to increase agricultural productivity to foster an inclusive and sustained reduction in hunger, poverty, and malnutrition. The activity increases the availability and use of new and quality fertilizers through efficient private sector-led supply systems, which improve and sustain soil fertility in Senegal. The expected results are: improved and appropriate fertilizer formulas are developed and made available to farmers; proven and environmentally sound fertilizer products and technologies are disseminated and upscaled; and the fertilizer policy and regulatory environment is improved...FY 2020 funds will be used to conduct activities leading to soil nutrient deficiency mapping, which is important for "prescribing" appropriate fertilizer applications and for carrying out a quick inventory of other fertilizer technologies ready for scaling up. Proven technological options that will be upscaled are: (i) Fertilizer Deep Placement (FDP) on rice and maize; (ii) Micro-Dosing (MD) on sorghum and millet; and (iii) Multi-Nutrient FDP on vegetables. Dundël Suuf will also link private investors with producer organizations to form input supply networks; and carry out COVID-19 response activities to minimize distortions in the fertilizer supply chain and promote farmer adoption of productivity-enhancing, agro-input packages - this will be done by implementing 500 fertilizer-seed kits in demonstration plots during off-season cropping activities, and will prioritize vulnerable, women-led farmer groups. This activity is fully aligned with the Feed the Future initiative, and supports Senegal's Mission Objective of increasing inclusive economic growth, along with broader U.S. Government priorities such as Goal 2 ("Increase Mutually Beneficial Economic Growth, Trade, and Investment") of the Department of State/USAID Joint Regional Strategy for Africa... .. .. .

(Cote d'Ivoire): .The Accountability for Development (A4D) activity is designed to address accountability and service delivery challenges in particular related to the lack of civil society influence with government, participatory government-citizen interactions. The purpose of A4D is to engage civil society organizations (CSO) and the government of Côte d'Ivoire (GoCI) at the local and national levels, to reduce underlying sources of conflict and tension in A4D target communities. In May 2020, USAID/Côte d'Ivoire received $1,100,000 of FY 2020 supplemental Economic Support Funds (ESF) to implement a set of activities to increase community resilience to prevent the spread and respond to the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic in Côte d'Ivoire's rural and urban areas, particularly along trade border and high conflict-risk areas. The DRG team is modifying the A4D activity to include COVID-19 response activities. This will bring the total estimated amount (TEA) of the award to $4,968,397. ..FY 2020 funds will target capacity building, strengthen citizen networks and oversight mechanisms, and address the non-health impact of COVID-19. A4D will work with local champions to identify local service delivery priorities and communicate them to the appropriate officials through innovative approaches. A4D will work with local and regional government entities to respond to increased citizens' demands for tangible outcomes, establish COVID-19 response coordination mechanisms, disseminate accurate information on COVID-19 transmission prevention measures at the community level, and counter disinformation and misinformation through traditional and social media. Finally, USAID will provide targeted economic opportunities and social support to youth and women affected by COVID-19 related travel and trade restrictions along trade and border routes. This activity contributes directly to the ICS Strategic Objective 1.3.... .. .. .. .. ...

sector.narrative: Rule of Law and Human Rights

description.narrative: In a context of political or other non-conflict related transition or other process requiring broad social consensus, promote societal discourse and agreement on democratic reform, rules, and institutional frameworks. Promote broad-based participation in determining, defining, and negotiating changes to governing structures and processes. Illustrative examples include promoting inclusive consensus-building processes related to national dialogues, and referenda on key issues. Programs are designed to incorporate and support mechanisms that advance the mediation, negotiation, and resolution of political disputes in the context of these processes. Funding in support of post-conflict work should be captured under PS.6 or PS.9, as appropriate.

title.narrative: Sustainable Financing for Water and Sanitation Services

description.narrative: Expand sustainable provision of FP/RH service in clinical and non-clinical programs including those in the public, private, NGO and PVO sectors, and at the community level; activities that help improve the quality of the services and care provided including pre- and in-service training of providers and application of evidence-based service delivery norms and standards; and availability of a wide range of contraceptive options (temporary methods, fertility awareness methods, long-acting reversible and permanent methods) for men and women. (N.B. Commodity procurement/ supply chain assistance is HL.7.6, a separate element.) Improve responsiveness to client needs including the FP/RH needs of youth and men, women and girls affected by violence, refugees/IDP, and other underserved populations. Included are activities that integrate FP and related RH care, including integrated FP/MCH services, especially provision of postpartum FP, FP information within the ANC setting, and post-abortion care; FP in the context of HIV/AIDS/STI prevention, treatment, care and support; fistula prevention and repair; prevention and mitigation of gender-based violence in the context of FP/RH programs; and programs that encourage abandonment of female genital cutting and other harmful traditional practices associated with negative RH outcomes. Facility construction and renovation specifically for FP/RH service delivery improvements is also included in this element.

title.narrative: Última cadeia de aprovisionamento da milha

description.narrative: (Mozambique): .The Last Mile Supply Chain (LMSC) activity aims.to improve the availability of medical commodities at the site level where.needed for disease diagnosis and treatment, contributing to USAID's CDCS.Intermediate Result (IR) 4.3 to strengthen the systems to deliver health,.nutrition, and social services and sub-IR 4.3.2 to improve the logistics.management of commodities to ensure availability at local levels. Following.similarly-designed PEPFAR-funded activities in Zambezia province, FY 2018 funds.will be used to initiate activities in Nampula province focusing on ensuring.the availability of maternal and child health and family planning commodities..Specifically, LMSC will negotiate project start-up with the Mozambique Ministry.of Health, arrange third party logistics providers for Nampula province,.conduct logistics assessments, complete the project design and scale-up plan.for the province, and establish an office and staff for the province. Specific.strategies to foster self-reliance will be operationalized to increase the host.government's ability to contribute to and sustain the commodities delivery.system in Nampula province. Lessons learned will be documented and shared with.other provinces..

Especificamente, LMSC negociará a partida do projeto com a saúde de Moçambique Ministry.of, arranjará fornecedores da logística do terceiro para a província de Nampula, as avaliações da logística de .conduct, terminará o projeto de projeto e a escala-acima plan.for a província, e estabelece um escritório e um pessoal para a província. Specific.strategies para promover a confiança será tornado operacional para aumentar a capacidade de host.government para contribuir a e sustentar as mercadorias delivery.system na província de Nampula. title.narrative: Eficiências para a atividade clínica dos resultados do VIH (ECO) em Moçambique

description.narrative: (Mozambique): USAID/Mozambique proposes a set of TB activities that align with the national strategic vision and support the Global Accelerator targets of treating 40 million people by 2022. ECHO will increase demand for quality TB services by implementing household TB screening, monitor referrals for symptomatic individuals, provide treatment support through home visits, and host TB screening health fairs, thus serving as a major actor in the national TB response. Historically, USAID's efforts in these areas have contributed to 15-25% of the national TB case notifications, achieved treatment success rates above 90%, improved contact tracing, and increased provision of Isoniazid Preventive Therapy (IPT) for child contacts of confirmed TB patients. To address poor IPT completion rates, the Government of the Republic of Mozambique (GRM) recently approved multi-month dispensing of IPT. With FY19 funds, ECHO will implement this critical intervention using patient- and family-centered approaches that facilitate more effective monitoring of patient outcomes. GRM has already initiated some small-scale research-oriented activities to consider 3HP (an IPT alternative) and ECHO remains ready to support its implementation and expansion. ECHO will work closely with GRM to improve the patient referral flow as well as undertake a TB lab network optimization exercise, increasing the likelihood of quality and timely results.ECHO will provide clinical support and mentor ship for implementing infectious control (IC) protocols and monitoring site-level IC dashboards. This will ensure providers can identify and properly treat multi-drug resistant TB while scaling new drugs and implementing shorter course regimens. ECHO will also strengthen the data collection, reporting, and analysis of the TB quality assurance cascade by working closely with local actors and key TB stakeholders to ensure that programmatic data are being appropriately synthesized for decision-making purposes.

O objetivo das eficiências para a atividade clínica dos resultados do VIH (ECO) é apoiar o governo da realização de Mozambiques (GRM) do controle epidêmico e de estabelecer de HIV/AIDS uma resposta sustentável, dirigido pelo governo do VIH em 2023 nas províncias onde USAID é o sócio clínico preliminar do apoio. O ECO centrar-se-á sobre 5 objetivos. Na parceria próxima com o GRM, autoridades do DPS de MISAU e de sócio e utilização do ECO técnico das considerações de PEPFARs: 1) Reforce os serviços de saúde públicas essenciais necessários para o controle epidêmico do VIH a nível do nacional, o provincial e do distrito para assegurar a sustentabilidade a longo prazo da resposta do VIH. 2) Cobertura do tratamento do alcance 95% VIH em regiões geográficas designadas em Moçambique para o fim da atividade. 3) Alcance pelo menos a supressão viral de 95% entre os povos que recebem a terapia antiretroviral e mantenha este nível de supressão durante a vida da atividade em regiões geográficas designadas em Moçambique; 4) Assegure-se de que Moçambique esteja utilizando a evidência a mais atrasada para a escala rápida acima de e a manutenção de intervenções eficazes do VIH, o ECO reverá rotineiramente a experiência global e anualmente ajustará, adotará, e executará intervenções da prioridade; e 5) Gerencia a evidência e forneça o GRM os dados, os resultados medidos, e as recomendações necessárias fazer as decisões chaves do fornecimento de serviços que apoiam a realização de alvos anuais de Mozambiques para o controle epidêmico.

title.narrative: Alcançar - Achieving Quality Health Services for Women and Children
Tratamento de complicações obstétricos e de inabilidades

description.narrative: (Mozambique): The goal of Alcançar - Achieving Quality Health Services for Women and Children; is to prevent maternal, neonatal, and child (MNCH) mortality in Nampula province, the country's most populous province with some of the worst MNCH, Family Planning (FP), and Nutrition indicators. Using FY 2020 funding, USAID will continue to establish Nampula as a model province for increasing utilization of high-quality, high-impact, gender-responsive, patient-centered MNCH, FP, and Nutrition services by addressing the barriers to accessible, high-quality services. The activity will complement efforts of other USAID-supported activities in Nampula, such as the Integrated Family Planning Project and follow-on, Transform Nutrition, supply chain strengthening activities, a new government-to-government agreement, and malaria programs, through a synchronized approach that engages host government officials, health facilities, and health providers, as active participants. The project will work in concert with the Global Financing Facility, ensuring that technical assistance is complementary. Alcançar will also provide technical support at the central level through the presence of three technical advisors, embedded within the Ministry of Health, to operationalize the Quality Improvement and Humanization Strategy and other interventions critical for maternal and child health. To prevent maternal, neonatal and child mortality, Alcançar will: strengthen linkages between communities and health facilities; improve delivery of MNCH services including immunization, FP, and nutrition in health facilities; improve host government management of health resources and systems; and strengthen government capacity for quality improvement and respectful, patient-centered delivery of health services. To achieve these aims, the project will deliver a package of technical support to health service providers, district health management teams and the Provincial Health Directorate

A educação do apoio sobre o reconhecimento das complicações durante o trabalho, a entrega e o após o parto e tratamento de complicações obstétricos pelas mulheres, seus sócios e a comunidade, tal como o cuidado do cargo-aborto, gestão da hipertensão, indução ou aumento de trabalha, entrega ajudada, transfusão de sangue, cirurgia (que inclui a seção cesarean, o reparo das dilacerações, e a gestão da hemorragia após o parto); e gestão das inabilidades gravidez-relacionadas que incluem a identificação do caso, gestão médica de problemas crônicos tais como a anemia, e reabilitação cirúrgica do reparo e a pós-operatório da fístula obstétrico.

title.narrative: Integrated Social Behavior Change Communication (SBCC) activity
Projeto de programa e aprendizagem - projeto de programa e aprendizagem

description.narrative: (Mozambique): .The "Programa Inter-Religioso Contra a Malaria" (PIRCOM) is a faith-based non-profit organization comprised of leaders from different religions committed to tackling pressing public health problems in their communities. PIRCOM's approach includes dissemination of key health messages, using sermons, community radio, and other inter-personal communication strategies. PIRCOM was originally founded in response to the malaria epidemic, but their strategic plan now emphasizes the need to expand to include other priority health areas in Mozambique. PIRCOM's "Health for Faith Project" strives to improve the behaviors of youth, pregnant and lactating women, newborns, children under five, and members of households, to prevent and treat malaria infections, and address nutrition, maternal health, family planning, neonatal/child health and HIV/AIDS through complementary communication approaches to behavior change. With FY 2020 funds, PIRCOM will conduct training of trainer sessions for religious leaders, who will then disseminate key messages to segmented audiences in their communities. PIRCOM will develop and produce materials that it will use to implement activities. The combined package of materials will include a training manual for religious leaders on how to incorporate health messages into sermons and how to select scriptures for sermons. Packages will also include materials for adolescents and young people. PIRCOM will strengthen the link with health units by creating a referral and counter referral system between the health unit and religious leaders. PIRCOM will train referral health unit staff in select districts to help facilitate and manage these referrals. The Mission will implement this activity in coordination with USAID's nutrition, maternal and child health, and malaria activities to ensure a cohesive, high-impact, integrated approach to reaching under-served women and their children..

Estabeleça e reforce sistemas de informação da saúde do país anfitrião, e construa a capacidade do país anfitrião recolher, analisar, disseminar, e use dados para a tomada de decisão. Inclui o apoio aos sistemas de informação rotineiros da saúde (RHIS) e os processos tais como os sistemas de informação facilidade-baseados da gestão em saúde (HMIS), a fiscalização, estatísticas vitais e registro civil, e monitoração do programa. Inclui recenseamentos e avaliações, avaliações de necessidades, estudos da linha de base, e avaliações visadas. Inclui avaliações de qualidade dos dados, e análise de dados, disseminação, e atividades do uso que apoiam os sistemas do país anfitrião, incluindo o acoplamento da sociedade civil para a responsabilidade. Inclui o apoio para traçar e para sistemas de informação geográficos e eletrônicos. Programas das tampas através do espectro dos serviços sanitários população-baseados aos cuidados médicos personalizados. O treinamento, as fontes, o equipamento, e os pessoais relativos do non-USG são incluídos. Não inclui atividades a favor de cumprir exigências do relatório de USG.

description.narrative: (Democratic Republic of the Congo): .This activity will strengthen the capacity of Congolese institutions and communities to deliver quality, integrated health services, sustainably reduce maternal and child deaths, and combat infectious diseases. IHP supports the DRC government's goal to provide essential health services for women and children. Encompassing malaria, maternal and child health, nutrition, family planning and reproductive health, tuberculosis, and WASH, this mechanism serves nearly 41 million people, or 30 percent of the Congolese population in nine provinces. IHP provides technical assistance, grants, training and community outreach to strengthen health systems and governance at provincial, health zone, facility, and community levels; increase equitable access to quality, integrated facility- and community-based health services; and foster adoption of healthy behaviors. IHP will: 1) increase capacity to plan, implement, and monitor, services at the provincial, zonal, and facility levels; 2) strengthen disease surveillance and strategic information gathering and use; 3) increase access to and appropriate use of essential health services and commodities, in coordination with USAID's supply chain investments; 4) support minor refurbishments to and equipping of health facilities to ensure their readiness to provide quality, lifesaving services; 5) improve health provider practices in support of respectful care; and 6) address care-seeking barriers (including gender-related) in collaboration with Breakthrough Action. IHP will collaborate, learn, and adaptat to ensure the continuity of essential health services in the face of COVID-19 and other shocks that threaten to disrupt core health system functions. IHP will also support and document innovation and scale-up of high-impact interventions to foster healthier, more resilient, and more productive communities. ..

title.narrative: Children and Youth Education Response Activity CYERA

description.narrative: (Democratic Republic of the Congo): Due to existing crises 3.5 million Congolese primary school children are not in school. Adolescent girls in conflict and displaced settings are especially at risk of sexual and gender-based violence, which often leads to drop out and further vulnerability. To address these challenges, TBD Children and Youth Education Response Activity (CYERA) will increase children's access to education, create safer learning environments, and improve the quality of teaching and learning in schools. CYERA will target children and youth (both girls and boys) living in crisis- and conflict-affected communities of Ituri, North Kivu, and South Kivu. CYERA is designed to deliver rapid education services in other provinces (e.g., Haut Uele, Tanganyika, Kasaï Central) if and when requested based on anticipated needs. Equal access to quality education can create pathways for greater economic growth, improved health outcomes, sustained democratic governance, and more peaceful and resilient societies. CYERA will build the resilience of Congolese children and youth so they propel the DRC on its own journey to self- reliance. Additionally, FY 2020 resources will be provided as grants to local organizations focused on child protection and education. These grants will help a new set of domestic implementing partners develop their technical and administrative capacity to deliver such programs in the future without an international intermediary. .CYERA will advance CDCS DO 2 by strengthening education services delivery, increasing access to education services, and improving collaboration between education actors. CYERA will also contribute to TO 3 by strengthening individual and community resilience through education, by strengthening the institutional resilience of local actors, and by restoring services for crisis- and conflict-affected populations, including those impacted by COVID and Ebola... ........

(Ethiopia): READ II's goal is to improve the.reading proficiency and educational attainment of 15 million children in order.to lead them to productive lives and drive Ethiopia's economic, social, and.political development. READ II interventions directly support the Agency's.strategic focus on literacy by equipping teachers with effective early grade.reading instruction techniques and grade appropriate materials in seven local.languages and English. .FY2020 funds will provide students.in the six target regions with a learning-supportive environment in schools,.communities, and homes. Through technical assistance, USAID will improve.the usability of the training materials to make early grade literacy materials.more responsive and adaptable to teacher and classroom exigencies, enhance teacher.training and professional development programs, increase the engagement between.youth and parents with the schools, and improve the leadership and management.capacity of school administrators to provide support and guidance to teachers..In addition, READ II will address school-related gender-based violence through.the implementation of a radio drama focused on empowering students to persevere.in their education and in life despite societal and gender barriers. .Furthermore, to ensure that.students' access to education and learning is not interrupted given ongoing.unrest and shocks such as the global COVID-19 public health emergency, READ II.will support and build the capacity of MOE structures and schools to i).identify crisis triggers, ii) develop crisis response plans, iii) establish.early warning systems, iv) mobilize and manage resources, and vii) advocate for.the MOE to establish a permanent Education in Emergency unit. This activity.contributes to Development Objective 4 of USAID/Ethiopia's CDCS (Sustained.Improvements in Essential Service Delivery). .... ...

description.narrative: (Ethiopia): .This activity will support the Ministry of Health (MOH)'s work to enhance its various networks of health information systems to improve evidence-based decision making. USAID will collaborate with the MOH's Data Use Partnership (DUP) which brings together the diverse partners working across the health information systems spectrum in Ethiopia. USAID will continue supporting the electronic Health Information System (HIS) to improve decision making by strengthening data collection, management, analysis, and utilization of health data at all levels of the health care delivery system. Information generated is critical to regularly monitor delivery of health care and the status of disease patterns, and to plan future health interventions. .FY 2020 funds will be used to undertake the following interventions: assess maturity of Ethiopia's HIS and finalize the draft roadmap that will guide the phased approach to fully digitize the health sector by starting with critical missing elements; create model Information Revolution institutions (center of excellence sites) across the different layers of the health system (district, hospital, health center, health post) to demonstrate best practice for improved data quality and data use for decision making in order to improve the health and well-being of the population. In addition, the activity will develop the technical and professional competence of the HIS workforce across the spectrum for maximum utilization of digitized tools for quality data generation, data use at the point of generation, self-reliance on maintaining the system, sustainability for continued use and avail the right set of data for informing policy decisions...

description.narrative: (Libya): .The Local Governance and Civil Society (LGCS) activity increases the capacity of targeted institutions to coordinate, plan, and manage the delivery of services at the municipal level; enhance the ability of communities to identify and address local priority issues; and strengthen linkages between national and sub-national systems in a state of nascent decentralization. Working together, these objectives help the Government of Libya to demonstrate responsiveness to the needs of its citizens. USAID supports municipalities in Libya's west, east, and south to improve citizen-level service delivery and other non-sectoral services that are seen and felt by citizens on a daily basis. USAID will work with 30 municipalities, as well as community-associated civil society organizations (CSOs) to address locally-identified problems and sources of grievances. This activity will also support local partners to work constructively with central government institutions to expand municipal resources to respond to citizen concerns. This activity also supports the USG's response to the COVID-19 crisis in Libya by providing crisis response training to relevant municipal staff, providing technical assistance to municipalities' crisis response units, and providing in-kind and technical assistance to mitigate specific second-order effects of the crisis..This program is designed to maximize flexibility and responsiveness. It includes a quarterly work plan review and update cycles, and a rolling geographic selection that allows flexibility to pivot the program where needed. USAID maintains funding flexibility in out-years to be as responsive as possible to a range of circumstances, including emerging priorities for Libya.

description.narrative: The goal of USAID/SA's "Accelerating Program Achievements to Control the Epidemic 2018-2023" (APACE) is to improve upon and expand comprehensive clinical and non-clinical differentiated HIV care and treatment services, which will accelerate and sustain HIV epidemic control in South Africa supporting achievement of the NSP 2017-2022 goals and the "90-90-90" targets. APACE reflects the urgency to accelerate the HIV response in South Africa. BroadReach HealthCare will implement the Accelerating Program Achievements to Control the Epidemic (APACE) activities in Kwa Zulu Natal and Mpumalanga provinces.

title.narrative: Power Africa: Nigeria Power Sector Program (NPSP)

description.narrative: (USAID Africa Regional): The Nigeria Power Sector Program (NPSP) task order seeks comprehensive reform within Nigeria's power sector, addressing gas-to-power challenges, competitive procurement of clean and conventional energy, regulatory and policy reforms to foster the enabling environment for greater sector transparency and private investment, utility distribution sector reform, and off-grid electricity access. NPSP's established infrastructure enables them to respond to changing political and economic conditions, as recently displayed in NPSP's quick response to the COVID 19 pandemic...To achieve its goals of 10,000 MW and 3 million new connections to homes and to small and medium businesses by 2023, NPSP will: 1) continue to provide senior technical advisors to the core Federal Government of Nigeria (FGN) beneficiary ministries; 2) provide trainings to FGN and the private sector; and 3) convene local counterparts and donors to advance policies and build capacity...NPSP will continue its assistance to the private sector though subject matter experts and subcontractors, including project developers, local and international financial institutions and investors, and equipment providers by building models and providing analysis to increase access to financing. It will also support improvements through more more efficient system operations within power distribution companies to reduce losses and increase collections...Finally, NPSP will continue to foster enhanced roles for women in power sector institutions by promoting skill development, better hiring practices, increased access to finance for female entrepreneurs, and policy reforms to incorporate gender into energy planning. In addition, strengthening community engagement on key reforms and policies is an integral part of each program outcome....

title.narrative: Programme de -grille de l'Afrique de puissance (PAOP)

description.narrative: (USAID Africa Regional): The Power Africa Off-grid Project (PAOP) provides technical assistance and targeted grant funding to support the development of Africa's off-grid solar home system (SHS) and mini-grid sectors. Starting in FY 2020, under its Cross-Sectoral Integration which supports the nexus between energy and other areas such as health, agriculture and education, the project will significantly increase the share of support offered to the electrification of health facilities in response to the COVID-19 pandemic. Through a team of resident technical advisors across East, Central and West Africa, PAOP works with companies, investors, and governments to advance the role of the private sector in extending energy access. The project focuses on 12 countries in East, Central and West Africa namely: Cameroon, Côte d'Ivoire, Democratic Republic of Congo, Ethiopia, Ghana, Kenya, Liberia, Niger, Rwanda, Senegal, Tanzania, and Uganda...By offering broad-based market intelligence to investors and financiers to inform financial product design, advising governments on establishing supportive policy frameworks, providing hands-on support to companies, and supporting health facility electrification, PAOP helps to build the off-grid market to accelerate private sector-led energy access to households, businesses, as well as health facilities across the continent. PAOP's specific focus areas are:..Policy and regulatory workMarket dynamicsBusiness performanceAccess to financeCross-sectoral integration

(USAID Afrique régionale) : Le projet de -grille de l'Afrique de puissance (PAOP) fournit l'assistance technique et le placement visé de concession de soutenir le développement du système domestique solaire de la -grille de l'Afrique (SHS) et des secteurs de mini-grille. Par une équipe de conseillers techniques résidents à travers est et Afrique de l'ouest, PAOP fonctionne avec des sociétés, des investisseurs, et des gouvernements pour avancer le rôle du secteur privé dans l'accès de élargissement d'énergie. Le projet se concentre sur 10 pays en Afrique de l'ouest d'Afrique de l'Est et : Le Kenya, Tanzanie, Rwanda, Ethiopie, Ghana, Sénégal, C&ocirc ; d'Ivoire, le Cameroun, le République démocratique du Congo et le Niger de te. Pendant l'année à venir, PAOP explorera également des occasions de travailler au Soudan. En offrant l'information commerciale variée aux investisseurs et aux financiers d'informer la conception de produits financière, conseillant des gouvernements sur établir les cadres de politique de support, et fournir l'appui pratique aux sociétés, PAOP aide à établir le marché de -grille pour accélérer l'accès dirigé par le secteur privé d'énergie. Les secteurs spécifiques du foyer de PAOP sont :. Politique et travail de réglementation. Information commerciale. Rendement de l'entreprise. Access à financer. Intégration intersectorielle.

This agreement will serve the hardest-to-reach rural and peri-urban poor and populations with difficult access to services in the four geographic regions of Eswatini, providing the most complicated HIV cases with comprehensive HIV and HIV/TB diagnostic, treatment, and prevention services. These clients are considered to be the most vulnerable, underserved populations in Eswatini; reaching these groups is imperative for the country to swiftly attain and sustain epidemic control, a shared objective by the Government of the Kingdom of Eswatini (GKoE) and United States Government (USG). The main objectives of this Activity are to: .1) Provide comprehensive HIV and HIV/TB testing, treatment and viral suppression services (95-95-95) for hard-to-reach, rural and underserved peri-urban populations..2) Provide high impact biomedical HIV prevention and sexual reproductive health package for hard-to-reach poor rural and peri-urban populations..3) Provide comprehensive HIV, HIV/TB, and cervical cancer outpatient and inpatient care for complex and difficult cases..4) Build capacity of Eswatini's healthcare professionals and local entities (NGO, government, and private sector) to provide quality HIV services to the hardest-to-reach communities.

title.narrative: Activité intégrée de services de santé

description.narrative: (Benin): .With FY 2020 funds, USAID will support the delivery of high-impact health interventions in the public sector, including malaria, family planning (FP), maternal and child health (MCH), and gender-based violence (GBV) services, contributing to the reduction of maternal, newborn, child, and adolescent girls' mortality and morbidity, with strong government and citizen engagement in the health sector. FY 2020 activities will include:1) improving the capacity of Health Zone Management Team and Departmental Health Directorates in management and supervision 2) strengthening local leadership, governance, and stewardship of health resources and services; 3) strengthening the management and technical capacity of local NGOs engaged in health service delivery, including the integrated package of community health services; 4) strengthening the capacity of local governments to use mobile technology and applications to improve health information management and health outcomes; and 5) reinforcing the capacity of the departmental and health zone teams as well as local leaders on health data use for decision making. The activity focuses on improving the quality and uptake of malaria, MCH, FP, and GBV health services, strengthening local leadership, management, and governance of health services, and supporting the MOH to lead and oversee the health system, with a special focus on MCH. This activity will support GOB institutions with technical and managerial capacity building, to achieve an end goal of a sustainable transition to local implementers with strong local governance. This activity contributes directly to JSP SO2.2 (Promote healthy, educated and productive populations in partner countries to drive inclusive and sustainable development, open new markets and support U.S. prosperity and security objectives) and SO3.4 (Project American values and leadership by preventing the spread of disease and providing humanitarian relief)..

(Le Bénin) :. Avec les fonds FY2018, USAID soutiendra la livraison des interventions à haute impression de santé dans le secteur public, y compris la malaria, le point de gel, MCH, et les services de GBV, contribuant à la réduction de maternel, nouveau-né, enfant et mortalité et morbidité de filles adolescentes, et activités FY2018 fortes d'engagement de gouvernement et de citoyen... incluront : - Amélioration de la capacité d'équipe de gestion de zone de santé et de la direction départementale de la santé dans la gestion et de la surveillance des services ; - Renforcement de la direction, du gouvernement, et de l'intendance locaux des ressources médicales ; - Renforcement de la prise de décision locale dans un contexte nouveau-décentralisé ; - Renforçant la gestion et la capacité technique d'O.N.G.s locales occupées dans la prestation de service de santé, y compris le paquet intégré des services de santé de la communauté ; - Renforcement de la capacité d'administrations locales d'employer la technologie et les applications mobiles pour améliorer des résultats de gestion et de santé de l'information de santé. - Par le réseau des centres d'un soin d'arrêt, augmentant le nombre de femmes présentant ou réintroduisant la main d'oeuvre après des incidents de violence fondée sur le sexe rapportée à l'appui de l'initiative de W-GDP. Dans l'alignement de la stratégie régionale de l'Afrique du NSS et du but de l'administrateur transformer la manière que nous de faisons des affaires, cette activité soutiendra des établissements de GUEULE avec le bâtiment de capacité technique et gestionnaire, pour réaliser un objectif final d'une transition viable aux applicateurs locaux avec le gouvernement local fort. Cette activité contribue directement à JSP SO2.2 (favorisez les populations en bonne santé, instruites et productives dans des pays partenaires pour conduire inclus et développement durable, marchés ouverts et pour soutenir la prospérité des États-Unis et les objectifs de sécurité) et SO3.4 (des valeurs et la direction américaines de projet en empêchant la propagation de la maladie et en fournissant l'aide humanitaire)...

sector.narrative: Pandemic Influenza and Other Emerging Threats (PIOET)

title.narrative: Systèmes d'information stratégique de pays d'accueil (FP/RH)

description.narrative: (Benin): With FY 2020 funds, USAID will support the local non-governmental organization to implement and support a package of community-based high-impact health services in collaboration with the ministry-supported health zone staff, city council representatives, and other stakeholders. FY 2020 activities will include: 1) supporting the expansion of high-impact community health services such as rapid malaria diagnosis and treatment for children under five, encouraging regular health visits for pregnant women, promoting key hygiene actions, and providing family planning counseling and Sayana Press injections; 2) training community health workers in high-impact practices and supporting the supervision and oversight of community health workers to ensure the delivery of high-quality health services; 3) strengthening the use of data for decision making in community health programs, including data quality assessments, community data validations, and the incorporation of community data in the national health data system; and 4) advocating with local government officials to directly fund community health activities and identify alternative funding sources to support community health activities. The community health activities funded in FY 2020 will fill a critical gap in service provision for Benin's poor and vulnerable populations. In addition, USAID will also focus on building capacity among local non-governmental organizations and health providers to support and supervise the community health workers to ensure high-quality care for the most vulnerable populations. This activity contributes directly to JSP SO2.2 (Promote healthy, educated and productive populations in partner countries to drive inclusive and sustainable development, open new markets and support U.S. prosperity and security objectives) and SO3.4 (Project American values and leadership by preventing the spread of disease and providing humanitarian relief).

Augmentez la prestation viable du service de FP/RH dans des programmes cliniques et non-cliniques comprenant ceux dans les secteurs de public, privés, d'O.N.G. et de PVO, et au niveau communautaire ; activités qui aident à améliorer la qualité des services et du soin fournis comprenant la formation sur place pre-- et des fournisseurs et l'application des normes et des normes basées sur preuves de prestation de service ; et disponibilité d'un large éventail d'options contraceptives (méthodes provisoires, méthodes de conscience de fertilité, long-agissant méthodes réversibles et permanentes) pour les hommes et des femmes. (Aide de chaîne d'approvisionnements de fourniture de N.B. Commodity est HL.7.6, un élément distinct.) Améliorez la réactivité aux besoins de client comprenant les besoins de FP/RH de la jeunesse et les hommes, les femmes et les filles affectés par violence, refugees/IDP, et d'autres populations underserved. Incluses sont des activités qui intègrent le point de gel et le soin relatif de Rhésus, y compris des services intégrés de FP/MCH, particulièrement fourniture de l'information puerpérale de point de gel, de point de gel dans l'arrangement d'ANC, et de soin de courrier-avortement ; Point de gel dans le cadre de la prévention, du traitement, du soin et de l'appui de HIV/AIDS/STI ; prévention et réparation de fistule ; prévention et réduction de violence fondée sur le sexe dans le cadre des programmes de FP/RH ; et programmes qui encouragent l'abandon de la coupe génitale femelle et autres des pratiques traditionnelles nuisibles liées aux résultats négatifs de Rhésus. La construction et la rénovation d'installation spécifiquement pour des améliorations de prestation de service de FP/RH est également incluse dans cet élément.

title.narrative: Alimentez le futur Sénégal cultivant la nutrition (Kawolor)
Feed the Future Senegal Cultivating Nutrition (Kawolor)

description.narrative: (Le Sénégal) :. L'alimentation le futur Sénégal cultivant l'activité de nutrition (Kawolor) soutient le gouvernement des efforts du Sénégal d'améliorer le statut nutritionnel de sa population en augmentant la production, le marketing, et la consommation des produits alimentaires diversifiés, sains et nutritifs parmi 1,5 millions de Sénégalais, se concentrant en particulier sur réduire des insuffisances nutritionnelles des enfants en bas âge et des femmes de l'âge reproducteur. Les ressources de l'exercice financier 2018 veulent : renforcez la capacité locale d'améliorer la production des céréales, de l'horticulture, et du bétail de qualité ; facilitez l'adoption des pratiques en matière essentielles de nutrition et d'hygiène ; accès d'augmentation à l'eau potable et productive ; agro-industrie et accès locaux adoptifs aux finances ; favorisez l'habilitation des femmes ; et améliorez la sécurité globale de nourriture au niveau local. Cette activité soutient l'objectif de mission du Sénégal d'augmenter la croissance économique incluse, avec de plus larges priorités de gouvernement des États-Unis telles que le but 2 ("augmentez la croissance économique, le commerce, et l'investissement mutuellement salutaires") du département de la stratégie régionale commune de State/USAID pour l'Afrique... .

(Senegal): .The Feed the Future Senegal Cultivating Nutrition (Kawolor) activity supports the Government of Senegal's efforts to improve the nutritional status of its population by increasing the production, marketing, and consumption of diversified, healthy and nutritious food products among 1.5 million Senegalese, focusing particularly on reducing nutritional deficiencies of young children and women of reproductive age. FY 2020 resources will: strengthen local capacity to improve production and marketing of quality cereals, horticulture, and livestock; facilitate the adoption of essential nutrition and hygiene practices; increase access to potable and productive water; foster local agribusiness and access to finance; promote women's empowerment; and improve overall food security at the local level, while addressing food system shocks caused by COVID-19. This activity supports Senegal's Mission Objective of increasing inclusive economic growth, along with broader U.S. Government priorities such as Goal 2 ("Increase Mutually Beneficial Economic Growth, Trade, and Investment") of the Department of State/USAID Joint Regional Strategy for Africa..

title.narrative: Feed the Future Senegal Dekkal Geej

description.narrative: (Senegal): .This mechanism addresses the drivers of direct threats to ecosystems, habitats and species by: incentivizing appropriate and legal fishing behavior, practices and equipment; effective deterrence of illegal, unreported and unregulated (IUU) fishing; improved capacity to adapt to climate change; improved management of solid waste and pollutants, including plastics and micro-plastics; and reduced mangrove deforestation. The activity works to implement long-term solutions, supporting demand-driven, evidence-based policies and practices that promote healthier fishing grounds, improved market systems and livelihoods, strengthened food security, and coastal communities that are more resilient to environmental and climatic shocks. FY 2020 resources will support the following:..- formation of new coalitions and two major advocacy campaigns in favor of sustainable fisheries;..- new partnerships with institutions involved in the management of information useful for decision-making;..- continued collaboration with the Government of Senegal's Fisheries Ministry to assess the Vessel Monitoring System and the quality of data on illegal fishing;..- continued improvements to Senegal's co-management model for fisheries, including creating incentives and deterrents that support sustainable fishing; ..- as needed, combatting the effects of COVID-19 and supporting economic recovery; and..- on the policy front, further progress on financing climate adaption, subsidies, illegal fishing, decentralization, and private sector reinvestment, as well as transparency in dealing with the nascent oil & gas industry...This activity supports Senegal's Mission Objective of.increasing inclusive economic growth, along with broader U.S. Government.priorities such as Goal 2 ("Increase Mutually Beneficial Economic Growth,.Trade, and Investment") of the Department of State/USAID Joint Regional.Strategy for Africa... .. .. .

Assurez-vous que l'environnement et les ressources naturelles dont les vies humaines et les moyens de subsistance dépendent sont contrôlés des manières qui soutiennent la productivité et la croissance aussi bien qu'une population en bonne santé.

title.narrative: Sécurité de l'eau et activité de la résilience (WSR)

description.narrative: La sécurité de l'eau et l'activité de la résilience (WSR) seront mises en application au Niger et le Burkina Faso en tant qu'élément de la résilience dans le Sahel a augmenté (HAUSSE) le programme II et l'association de développement de Sahel (SDP). WSR est un volet intégral de programme de la HAUSSE II d'USAIDs en le Burkina Faso et le Niger, conçu pour adresser les causes premières du vulnerabilitywhich chronique est défini comme susceptibilité durable aux effets des chocs externes constants et cycliques sur la vie et des moyens de subsistance, ayant pour résultat l'insécurité persistante de nourriture et d'eau.

Water Security and Resilience (WSR) Activity will be implemented in Niger and Burkina Faso as part of the Resilience in the Sahel Enhanced (RISE) II program and the Sahel Development Partnership (SDP). WSR is an integral component of USAIDs RISE II program in Burkina Faso and Niger, designed to address the root causes of chronic vulnerabilitywhich is defined as an enduring susceptibility to the effects of constant and cyclical external shocks on life and livelihoods, resulting in persistent food and water insecurity.

title.narrative: Commercializing Horticulture - Small Business Applied Research (SBAR) Pilot

description.narrative: (Senegal): .This activity is implemented through a U.S.-based small business as a pilot research activity, to commercialize horticulture opportunities for rural farmers through bundling packages of technology and technical support services. The activity tests the hypothesis that if financial institutions and horticulture value chain actors work together to offer innovative financial products and services, small holder farmers can commercialize their horticultural production. Approximately two-thirds of the Senegalese diet is focused on cereals, with significant issues of malnutrition in rural areas. Activities focus on increasing the quality and quantity of horticulture production and its commercialization, and thus improving diet diversity and address the nutrition gap... ..FY 2020 funds will be used to:..- facilitate partnerships among small-holder horticultural producers and horticultural input suppliers, last mile entrepreneurs, off-takers/intermediaries, and buyers to create innovative financial products and new technology packages that bundle together technical assistance with market linkages;..- identify the best sequencing of new technologies, the appropriate role of community agents in stimulating investment, and the extent to which risks can be reduced through improved partnerships, planning, and training; and..- identify and address the impact of COVID-19 on the horticultural value chain...The activity supports Senegal's Mission Objective of increasing inclusive economic growth, along with broader U.S. Government priorities such as Goal 2 ("Increase Mutually Beneficial Economic Growth, Trade, and Investment") of the Department of State/USAID Joint Regional Strategy for Africa..

L'agriculture est la science et la pratique de la nourriture, l'alimentation, et la production de fibre (sylviculture y compris, faune, pêche, aquiculture et floraculture) et ses relations aux ressources naturelles, au traitement, au marketing, à la distribution, à l'utilisation (nutrition y compris), et au commerce.

(Le Madagascar) :. L'activité de Mikajy soutiendra l'aide basée sur site dans le cadre du plan environnemental de la mission. Elle adressera les conducteurs des menaces principales pour la biodiversité à moins de deux zones géographiques prioritaires. L'activité se concentrera sur la gestion améliorée de la biodiversité unique du Madagascar ; promotion des moyens de subsistance résilients ; établir la capacité de société civile ; et actions à l'appui des politiques pour améliorer le gouvernement de ressource naturelle. Il fournira l'assistance technique et la formation sur la gestion terrestre et marine de zones protégées aux associés dans 2 paysages (Menabe et Mamabaie). Mikajy enseignera les techniques exigées pour améliorer et diversifier des moyens de subsistance sur la gestion de paysage viable et pour replier de bons exemples de paiement pour des initiatives environnementales de service au Madagascar. Il formera les communautés sur la façon dont se connecter par interface à d'autres programmes de développement sur fournir des services aux communautés pour favoriser leur résilience. Il soutiendra le développement de la planification spatiale niveau de la commune et marine. Il aligne avec la politique de la biodiversité d'USAID pour conserver la biodiversité pour que le développement viable et résilient et son but conserve la biodiversité dans des zones prioritaires, et intègre la biodiversité dans le développement humain. Cette activité aligne avec la stratégie de changement climatique et de développement d'USAID et factorisera dans des considérations de risque de climat dans toutes les activités appropriées. Mikajy contribue aux efforts de cesser des échanges illicites de faune sous la stratégie des États-Unis pour combattre le trafic de faune. L'approche de nature, de richesse, et de puissance est bonne pour que la Co-gestion et l'engagement local contrôle la biodiversité, diversifier des moyens de subsistance, et renforce la sécurité de tenure. La tétra technologie a des réseaux des organismes locaux, et des investisseurs à s'exercer, mentor, et des acteurs de gouvernement de soutien. Elle évaluera et adaptera chaque intervention. Son approche aidera les communautés à devenir plus résilientes aux crises tout en assurant la longévité de la biodiversité riche du pays.

(Madagascar): .The Mikajy activity supports site-based assistance under USAID's Conservation and Communities Project to address the drivers of key threats to biodiversity within two geographic priority zones (Menabe and Mamabaie). The activity will advance biodiversity conservation in forest and coastal ecosystems, strengthen natural resource management and land tenure security among vulnerable populations, and promote sustainable economic growth in rural communities while contributing to the reduction of Global Greenhouse Gas emissions and increasing carbon sequestration...Mikajy will empower protected area managers and communities in improving the management of forest and marine areas by increasing patrolling, reinforcing firefighting, and combating wildlife trafficking to address the upsurge of environmental crimes caused by the COVID-19. Mikajy will contribute to Madagascar's national reforestation initiative through protected area and mangrove restoration and community-managed agroforestry. Mikajy will provide technical assistance and grants for the establishment of locally managed marine areas and support to the legal framework for the fisheries management plan to include the local "dina" (traditional arbitrage system) in addition to training for sustainable fisheries management. Mikajy will expand its support to certified vanilla cooperatives to include more members; and will engage in other value chains in partnership with the private sector to build community resilience. Mikaly will prioritize securing land and resource tenure with decentralized natural resource management governance and civil society empowerment...... .

title.narrative: Améliorant les associations et l'Access du marché aux marchandises ensemble (IMPACT)
Improving Market Partnerships and Access to Commodities Together (IMPACT)

description.narrative: (Madagascar): IMPACT's objective is to improve the capacity of the health system to ensure quality pharmaceuticals and health commodities are available and accessible to the Malagasy people on a sustainable basis. Using FP, PMI and MCH funds, IMPACT will build leadership and technical capacity of the Malagasy government to coordinate and manage the Total Market Approach (TMA), involving public, non-profit and commercial sectors. IMPACT will conduct assessments to better understand the market landscape, as well as provide technical assistance to the MOPH's multi-sectoral TMA working group and strengthen the capacity of actors to manage the supply chain for health commodities. IMPACT will support the MOPH in the national integrated quantification of health commodities process. ..IMPACT activity is the Mission's primary vehicle for distributing USG-funded health commodities procured by USAID's Global Health Supply Chain-Procurement and Supply Management and Central Contraceptive Procurement (CCP) activities. With FY2020 funds, IMPACT will distribute over 3,6 million insecticide-treated mosquito nets (ITN) during the June/July 2021 mass distribution campaign and contribute to the promotion and care of the ITNs through integrated social and behavior change outreach activities in addition to other malaria activities. IMPACT will also distribute MCH and FP/RH commodities. For the sustainability of the community-based distribution of life saving commodities, IMPACT will start to support the transition from the social marketing mechanism (PA and PARC) to the national distribution system (PhaGeCom and PhaGDIs). .. .

L'amélioration des associations et l'Access du marché à l'activité des produits ensemble (IMPACT) sera le véhicule primaire d'USAID/Madagascar pour renforcer les différents systèmes de chaîne d'approvisionnements pour maternel financé par USG et les santés de l'enfant (MCH), les marchandises de la planification des naissances de malaria et (point de gel) et l'assistance technique (VENTRES) pour le renforcement de système de chaîne d'approvisionnements.
